      if location is not given, this method assumes the current location as the required location if suggestion is not given, this method suggests a name "NewFile" If no file with the given name exists, it returns the name as it is.
      static String getUUIDBasedUniqueFileName(String location, String suggestion)
      suggest a unique file name in the absolute location provided so that the name don't clash with the existing names If a file with same name exists in server, it creates a UUID and append the file name to the UUID to generate a unique name else it returns the name as it is

        public static HashMap<String,String> stringToHashMap(String input,
                                     String delim1,
                                     String delim2)
        creates a hash map from key value pairs, each pair being separated by delimeter delim1 and key value being separated by delim2
        Parameters:
        input - the string to be converted into hash map
        delim1 - first delimeter to separate different key-value pairs
        delim2 - second delimeter to separate key from value
        Returns:
        the hashMap

      • readRequestLineFromClient

        public static String readRequestLineFromClient(InputStream clientInpStream)
                                        throws IOException,
                                               IllegalRequestException
        read request line from client. a request lIne is of form Request-Line = Method SP Request-URI SP HTTP-Version CRLF
        Parameters:
        clientInpStream - client Reader
        Returns:
        the request line without trailing \r\n
        Throws:
        IOException - when there is error in read
        IllegalRequestException - if an invalid request comes from client..

      • readHeaderFromClient

        public static String readHeaderFromClient(InputStream clientInpStream)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          IllegalRequestException
        read header from client and return it as a string this method assumes that the request line has been read from stream and is now not available
        Parameters:
        clientInpStream - stream connected to client
        Returns:
        header
        Throws:
        IOException - if header could not be read completely
        IllegalRequestException - if an invalid request comes from client..

      • readAndWriteByteStream

        public static void readAndWriteByteStream(InputStream in,
                          OutputStream out,
                          long size)
                                   throws IOException
        reads bytes from an InputStream and writes the same to an OutputStream
        Parameters:
        in - the input Stream to be read
        out - the output Stream to write
        size - number of bytes to read and write. if size = -1 then read until end of stream is found else write size number of bytes
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getUUIDBasedUniqueFileName

        public static String getUUIDBasedUniqueFileName(String location,
                                String suggestion)
        suggest a unique file name in the absolute location provided so that the name don't clash with the existing names If a file with same name exists in server, it creates a UUID and append the file name to the UUID to generate a unique name else it returns the name as it is
        Parameters:
        location - the absolute location to be checked
        suggestion - suggested name
        Returns:
        the unique name

      • getUniqueFileName

        public static String getUniqueFileName(String location,
                       String suggestion)
        if location is not given, this method assumes the current location as the required location if suggestion is not given, this method suggests a name "NewFile" If no file with the given name exists, it returns the name as it is. otherwise it creates name of format filename (index).extension the index goes from 2 to a fixed number indicated by - ServerParams.#NumberOfDuplicateFileNamesAcceptedInPostReq if all names are already used the method returns null
        Parameters:
        location - the path in which method needs to suggest appropriate name
        suggestion - the name suggested
        Returns:
        the suggested name. returns null if location is given but not valid.or file name given is directory or could not find an appropriate name

      • parseHTTPdate

        public static Date parseHTTPdate(String dateString)
                          throws ParseException
        used for parsing date coming with HTTP headers. it recognizes the standard in which date is received and parses accordingly. it differentiates only three date patters - RFC1123,Asctime,RFC850 . this method assumes that user sends date in either of the three above mentioned date format. In case user does not , it will fail will throw an Exception
        Parameters:
        dateString - the date to be parsed
        Returns:
        Date object
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the method could not recognize the date pattern

      • getCommonHeaders

        public static String getCommonHeaders()
        returns a string of headers common to all responses. It includes following headers 1. Server 2. Date 3. Connection see rfc 2616 it sends headers in following format *(message-header CRLF) message-header = field-name ":" [ field-value ] field-name = token field-value = *( field-content | LWS ) field-content =
        Returns:
        string of common headers

      • createResponseMessageWithoutBody

        public static String createResponseMessageWithoutBody(String statusCode,
                                      String statusMessage,
                                      String[] additionalHeaders)
        creates a response message without message body. can be used when no message body is required
        Parameters:
        statusCode - the http response status code to be sent
        statusMessage - status message corresponding to status code
        additionalHeaders - any additional headers if required, other than headers received from Helper.#getCommonHeaders()
        Returns:
        the message string

      • sendClientMessage

        public static void sendClientMessage(String statusCode,
                     String statusMessage,
                     String[] additionalHeaders,
                     File body,
                     BufferedWriter charStreamBufferedOut,
                     BufferedOutputStream byteStreamBufferedOut)
                              throws IOException
        sends client a response. takes a file to be treated as body of message
        Parameters:
        statusCode - the http response status code to be sent
        statusMessage - status message corresponding to status code
        additionalHeaders - any additional headers if required, other than headers received from Helper.#getCommonHeaders()
        body - to be sent as body of message
        charStreamBufferedOut - the stream connected to client
        byteStreamBufferedOut - the stream connected to client
        Throws:
        IOException - when some read/write error occurs

      • sendClientMessage

        public static void sendClientMessage(String statusCode,
                     String statusMessage,
                     String[] additionalHeaders,
                     String bodyMesg,
                     BufferedWriter charStreamBufferedOut,
                     BufferedOutputStream byteStreamBufferedOut)
                              throws IOException
        sends a message to the client with some default formatting for body of message
        Parameters:
        statusCode - http response code
        statusMessage - http response message
        additionalHeaders - any additional header if required
        bodyMesg - short message to be inserted in body. this is placed in tag

        charStreamBufferedOut - the stream coonected to client
        byteStreamBufferedOut - the stream coonected to client
        Throws:
        IOException - when some read/write error occurs
